name: type-material
title: Type Material
description: Type material designated to names. Type material should only be associated with the original name, not with a recombination.

fields.name: ID
fields.title: ID
fields.description: Optional unique identifier for the specimen. If possible use the existing specimen identifier, e.g. the collection/institution code and catalogue number. If coming from a Darwin Core world dwc:occurrenceID is a great fit.

fields.name: nameID
fields.title: nameID
fields.description: A comma concatenated list of name IDs pointing to the typified name of this specimen. Each ID must refer to an existing Name.ID within this data package. See best practices for details on how to concatenate multi values.

fields.name: sourceID
fields.title: sourceID
fields.description: Optional identifier for the source this record came from as listed in the metadata.yaml

fields.name: citation
fields.title: citation
fields.description: Material citation of the type material, i.e. type specimen. The citation is ideally given in the verbatim form as it was used in the original publication of the name or the subsequent designation. Otherwise it is recommended to follow the material citation guidelines published by European Journal of Taxonomy. If atomized fields below are given a citation is not needed. Otherwise it is required.

fields.name: referenceID
fields.title: referenceID
fields.description: A referenceID pointing to the Reference table indicating the publication of the type designation. Most often this is equivalent to the original names referenceID, but for subsequent designations a later reference should be cited.

fields.name: page
fields.title: page
fields.description: The exact single page number where the type designation was published in the linked reference. If the value spans multiple pages, the first page should be given.

fields.name: country
fields.title: country
fields.description: The country of the type locality. Preferably as ISO codes.

fields.name: locality
fields.title: locality
fields.description: The type locality. Ideally from largest area to smallest.

fields.name: latitude
fields.title: latitude
fields.description: Decimal latitude of the type locality given in WGS84

fields.name: longitude
fields.title: longitude
fields.description: Decimal longitude of the type locality given in WGS84

fields.name: altitude
fields.title: altitude
fields.description: Altitude of the type locality. Ideally given as meters above mean seal level. Depth should be given as negative altitudes.

fields.name: host
fields.title: host
fields.description: Indicates the host organism from which the type specimen was obtained (symbiotype).

fields.name: date
fields.title: date
fields.description: Date the type material was gathered. Recommended to be given as ISO 8601 dates.

fields.name: collector
fields.title: collector
fields.description: The collectors name

fields.name: institutionCode
fields.title: institutionCode
fields.description: The name or acronym in use by the institution having custody of the material.

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.title: catalogNumber
fields.description: The identifier for the specimen in a collection.

fields.name: link
fields.title: link
fields.description: A link to further information about the specimen, e.g. as provided by the institute holding the collection.

fields.name: remarks
fields.title: remarks
fields.description: Any further remarks on the type material.

fields.name: modified
fields.title: modified
fields.description: UTC timestamp in ISO format to represent the time the record was last modified.

fields.name: modifiedBy
fields.title: modifiedBy
fields.description: Author identifier indicating the person who has last modified the record.
